DOCNAME: CASE OF STANDARD VERLAGS GMBH v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (victim);Violation of Art. 10;Not necessary to examine Art. 6;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of the DATE newspaper “ der Standard ” .

CARDINAL . In the issue of “ der Standard ” of CARDINAL March CARDINAL the applicant published an article in the context of criminal proceedings on charges of large scale fraud and embezzlement against a former Member of ORG of ORG ( ORG , “ the ORG ” ) , Mr PERSON .
CARDINAL . The article whose author , ORG , is a well - known court room reporter , reads as follows :
“ ‘ I had more important things to DATE
PERSON claims he was unaware of ORG ’s loan machinations

As expected , ORG ( ORG ) politicians offered their resignation DATE in connection with the PERSON trial . ( On the contrary : the ORG ’s long - serving legal counsel has suddenly become Minister of ORG . )

There is no way back for the CARDINAL in the dock , however . PERSON , the former ORG member of ORG , is accused of having colluded in aggravating the collapse of the poultry firm belonging to his brother PERSON , known as ‘ LOC . He knew little about it

CARDINAL member of PERSON former chicken coop ( if this casual expression is permitted ) who is still in office took his turn in the witness box DATE : PERSON , now a member of the NORP regional government but at the time the leader of the ORG ’s parliamentary group . In that capacity he is alleged to have known even before DATE that loans and guarantees from the Circle of ORG ( ORG ) nourished ORG ’s chickens , fed his suppliers and enticed his creditors . In any event , PERSON claims to have ‘ handed over all ORG . But PERSON has no recollection of this . ‘ As parliamentary group leader I had more important things to do than worry about lists of that PERSON , he retorts . ORG claims that he heard CARDINAL loan , in which ORG had agreed to borrow MONEY from ORG funds . PERSON asked for an explanation . He is alleged to have reiterated that version of events in DATE at a meeting of ORG party executive , in the presence of the federal party leaders . And it was believed . PERSON himself was doubtful and made an early exit .

‘ Whether the federal party was informed or not is a matter on which everyone may now form his or her own view’ , the judge summed up exclusively for all the journalists in the courtroom . ‘ However , it will not settle the criminal proceedings.’ Irrespective of this , the fraud trial will drag on further DATE with witness statements . ”
CARDINAL . The article was accompanied by a photograph of PERSON and the following text :
“ The former leader of the ORG ’s parliamentary group , PERSON , gives evidence defending the party ’s ignorance of the co - financing of the ORG collapse ” .

CARDINAL . The criminal proceedings against Mr ORG received extensive media coverage . Mr PERSON and a number of co - accused were eventually convicted of large scale fraud and embezzlement by ORG . Its judgment was confirmed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON brought private prosecution proceedings for defamation under LAW ( Mediengesetz ) as regards the statement :

“ He [ Mr PERSON ] is alleged to have known even before DATE that loans and guarantees from the Circle of ORG ( ORG ) nourished ORG ’s chickens , fed his suppliers and enticed his creditors . In any event , PERSON claims to have handed over all documents to PERSON . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) held a hearing . PERSON , who had been called as a witness , had refused to give evidence on the ground that he risked incriminating himself . According to the minutes , the applicant contested that PERSON was entitled to refuse giving evidence and requested the court to impose a fine on him . The ORG dismissed the request for the taking of evidence , finding that it was irrelevant and that the case was ready for decision . It did not give any detailed reasons .

CARDINAL . At the close of the hearing , the court gave judgment ordering the applicant to pay compensation of CARDINAL NORP schillings ( ORG , that is MONEY ( ORG ) ) to PERSON and to publish the judgment .

CARDINAL . In ORG view , the incriminated passage meant that Mr PERSON already new of PERSON fraudulent transactions before DATE . However , having regard to the evidence adduced in the criminal proceedings against PERSON , the court found that there was no indication that PERSON knew before DATE that loans or guarantees of ORG had been transferred to ORG ’s firm . It followed from TIME of the trial against ORG , that the latter had not claimed to have given all relevant documents to PERSON , but had only stated to have met another ORG politician in PERSON ’s office and to have given documents to that politician .

CARDINAL . Referring to Section CARDINAL of LAW , ORG found that the statement at issue fulfilled the elements of defamation ( üble GPE ) under LAW as it insinuated that PERSON PERSON had remained inactive despite being aware of fraudulent transactions . Thus , it accused him of behaviour likely to lower him in public esteem . Although the incriminated passage purportedly cited statements of third persons , the applicant company remained responsible since it had failed to present these quotes neutrally without identifying itself with their content . The article ’s style and choice of wording did not fulfil the requirements of a neutral presentation . In any case , the quote was not correct as PERSON had not claimed to have given PERSON all relevant documents nor had it been shown that the latter knew otherwise about the transactions . The applicant had , thus , failed to prove the truth of the impugned statement .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .

CARDINAL . It noted the applicant ’s argument that the article was of a satirical nature and that the reader , expecting a certain degree of exaggeration , concluded in essence that PERSON had known more than he admitted , or could have known more had he made the necessary investigations on the basis of the documents given to him .

CARDINAL . ORG conceded that ORG court room reports differed from usual reports of this genre . His irony and sarcasm were well - known and appreciated by the reader . In the present case however , the issue was not whether the author had made use of some degree of exaggeration . He had simply reported facts which were not true , as no documents at all had been handed over to PERSON . Furthermore , the court confirmed ORG view that the article had not quoted third ORG statements correctly and neutrally .

CARDINAL . Finally , ORG confirmed that ORG had rightly granted PERSON a right to refuse to give evidence in accordance with the relevant provisions of LAW . As the article at issue had reported on the criminal proceedings against Mr ORG , it was likely that he would , inter alia , have to give evidence as regards his fraudulent transactions . He therefore risked incriminating himself as regards the charges against him .
CARDINAL . The decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON filed an action under LAW ) and under LAW ) requesting the applicant to refrain from publishing his picture accompanied by the incriminated text , to publish the judgment and to pay him ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL as compensation for non - pecuniary damage . He also requested a preliminary injunction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and PERSON appeared before ORG ( ORG ) and concluded a partial agreement . The applicant undertook to refrain from publishing PERSON picture accompanied by any text similar to the impugned statement , and to publish the agreement . The court therefore limited the hearing to the issue of compensation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant to reimburse Mr PERSON ’s costs as regards the part of his claim that was covered by the partial agreement , but dismissed the latter ’s claim for compensation .

CARDINAL . ORG , referring to ORG established case - law as regards the binding force of a conviction in subsequent civil proceedings ( see relevant domestic law and practice , below ) , noted that the publication of PERSON picture accompanied by the impugned statement which fulfilled the objective elements of defamation , had violated his legitimate interests within the meaning of Section CARDINAL of LAW . He was , therefore , in principle entitled to receive compensation if the non - pecuniary damage suffered went beyond the annoyance usually caused by the unlawful publication of a picture . However , he had failed to substantiate that he had suffered any such damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed PERSON ORG ’s appeal .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW provides for the strict liability of the publisher in cases of defamation ; the victim can thus claim damages from him . In this context “ defamation ” has been defined in LAW ) , as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Anybody who , in such a way that it may be noticed by a third person , attributes to another a contemptible characteristic or sentiment or accuses him of behaviour contrary to honour or morality and such as to make him contemptible or otherwise lower him in public esteem shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fine ...

CARDINAL . Anyone who commits this offence in a printed document , by broadcasting or otherwise in such a way as to make the defamation accessible to a broad section of the public , shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding one year or a fine ...

CARDINAL . NORP The person making the statement shall not be punished if it is proved to be true . In the case of the offence defined in paragraph CARDINAL he shall also not be liable if circumstances are established which gave him sufficient reason to believe that the statement was true . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW , so far as material , provides :

“ CARDINAL . Images of persons shall neither be exhibited publicly , nor disseminated in any other way in which they are made accessible to the public , where the legitimate interests of the person in question or , in the event that they have died without having authorised or ordered publication , of a close relative would be injured . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW ( ORG ) provides as follows :
“ CARDINAL . Anybody who , due to defamation , suffered a damage or loss of profit , may claim for compensation .

CARDINAL . NORP The same applies if anyone is disseminating facts , which jeopardize another person ’s reputation , gain or livelihood , the untruth of which was known or must have been known to him . In this case there is also a right to claim a revocation and the publication thereof ... ”

CARDINAL . It is ORG constant case - law that a person who has been convicted in criminal proceedings can not argue in subsequent civil proceedings that he has not committed the offence at issue ( lead case CARDINAL Ob CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE , ORG ) .
